item.description: First listen to this song, and keep in mind, this is my mood throughtout this shitty story

item.title: BgRemover Part 2
item.description: Check out the previous post. work done until now code on github The original list(s): nice-ish working front to be able to upload/download files actual background removal mechanix, but since it’s python this should be doable host it somewhere in my infra for it to be usable Nice to have-s: instead of uploading an image pass a URL self-managed-file-deleting back-end option to select which model is used for the bgRemoval publically available on github to finally give back to community!

item.title: Elevators
item.description: code on github This week I learned about a new app for Androids: phyPhox. It was shown to me by a friend from work. It was in a context of measuring the speed of elevators in buildings… First things first - it allows to measure and log values from phones sensors - pressure, accelerometer, gyro, magnetometers, GPS, sound (amplitude, frequency). It’s a quite well written app. So, I have a super slow elevator in my building, where I live.

item.title: Rox
item.description: There is a bucket in my life. Not a bucket list, not a real bucket. A metaphor of a bucket. A place from which I feel like I draw my power. To do things, to be productive, “To strive, to seek, to find, and not to yield”. There's a secret place I like to go -Megadeth, Month before my birthday It’s a space, in which I find the willpower to run my life and do fun, impressive, good stuff.

item.title: First Photos With Apsc
item.description: On the weekend of 21-23.08.2025 I went to my home, where I took some photos with my new camera. I wouldn’t say these are the best photos in the world, and I still have to learn a lot.. Yet still, I’m happy with them!

item.title: BgRemover
Thev Log
item.description: Creating this blog is kind of a fun part for me. Partly I hate it, but partly it’s a ready-made solution which requires proper configuration and a reasonable time spent to make it work. It’s mildly infuriating until you actually try to deploy it in a reasonable place like github pages. At that point it becomes simply unbearable. It’s exactly like this, but I’m 3780 % more pissed than I should be ðŸ˜……
